channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Crunchbase Confirms Data Breach After Hacking Claims
item.description: Crunchbase was targeted alongside SoundCloud and Betterment in a ShinyHunters campaign. The post Crunchbase Confirms Data Breach After Hacking Claims appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Threat Hunting in an Age of Automation and AI
item.description: Understanding how threat hunting differs from reactive security provides a deeper understanding of the role, while hinting at how it will evolve in the future. The post Cyber Insights 2026: Threat Hunting in an Age of Automation and AI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Firewall Flaws, AI-Built Malware, Browser Traps, Critical CVEs & More
item.description: Security failures rarely arrive loudly. They slip in through trusted tools, half-fixed problems, and habits people stop questioning. This week’s recap shows that pattern clearly. Attackers are moving faster than defenses, mixing old tricks with new paths. “Patched” no longer means safe, and every...

item.title: ‘Stanley’ Malware Toolkit Enables Phishing via Website Spoofing
item.description: Priced $2,000 - $6,000 on a cybercrime forum, the MaaS toolkit promises publication on the Chrome Web Store. The post ‘Stanley’ Malware Toolkit Enables Phishing via Website Spoofing appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Winning Against AI-Based Attacks Requires a Combined Defensive Approach
item.description: If there’s a constant in cybersecurity, it’s that adversaries are always innovating. The rise of offensive AI is transforming attack strategies and making them harder to detect. Google’s Threat Intelligence Group, recently reported on adversaries using Large Language Models (LLMs) to both conceal...

item.title: TikTok Finalizes a Deal to Form a New American Entity
item.description: TikTok has finalized a deal to create a new American entity, avoiding the looming threat of a ban in the United States. The post TikTok Finalizes a Deal to Form a New American Entity appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Konni Hackers Deploy AI-Generated PowerShell Backdoor Against Blockchain Developers
item.description: The North Korean threat actor known as Konni has been observed using PowerShell malware generated using artificial intelligence (AI) tools to target developers and engineering teams in the blockchain sector. The phishing campaign has targeted Japan, Australia, and India, highlighting the...

item.title: MagicLab and GALBOT to Appear on China’s Spring Festival Gala
item.description: Two leading Chinese robotics startups, GALBOT and MagicLab, are set to showcase embodied AI robots at the Spring Festival Gala, highlighting the rapid rise of humanoid robotics in China.

item.title: Tencent Tests “Yuanbao Party,” Signaling a Push Into AI-Powered Social Networking
item.description: Tencent is testing “Yuanbao Party,” a new AI-powered social space that blends group interaction with AI participation, signaling its latest bet on social AI as the next growth lever.

item.title: AgiBot and Others Take Stakes in Chery-Backed AiMOGA
item.description: Chery-backed AiMOGA has attracted new strategic investors including AgiBot, as its humanoid robot Mornine and robotic dogs enter real-world deployment both in China and overseas.

item.title: Space Tourism for RMB 3 Million? Actor Johnny Huang and Over a Dozen Others Have Already Booked
item.description: With tickets priced at about USD 417,000, China’s first commercial crewed spacecraft has attracted celebrities and business leaders, signaling that space tourism is moving from concept to reality.

item.title: 2024 VMware Flaw Now in Attackers’ Crosshairs
item.description: The critical-severity vulnerability can be exploited via crafted network packets for remote code execution. The post 2024 VMware Flaw Now in Attackers’ Crosshairs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: When Agents Fail to Act: A Diagnostic Framework for Tool Invocation Reliability in Multi-Agent LLM Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.16280v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-agent systems powered by large language models (LLMs) are transforming enterprise automation, yet systematic evaluation methodologies for assessing tool-use reliability remain underdeveloped. We introduce a comprehensive diagnostic framework...

item.title: SemanticALLI: Caching Reasoning, Not Just Responses, in Agentic Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.16286v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Agentic AI pipelines suffer from a hidden inefficiency: they frequently reconstruct identical intermediate logic, such as metric normalization or chart scaffolding, even when the user's natural language phrasing is entirely novel. Conventional...

item.title: DSGym: A Holistic Framework for Evaluating and Training Data Science Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.16344v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Data science agents promise to accelerate discovery and insight-generation by turning data into executable analyses and findings. Yet existing data science benchmarks fall short due to fragmented evaluation interfaces that make cross-benchmark...

item.title: Doc2AHP: Inferring Structured Multi-Criteria Decision Models via Semantic Trees with LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2601.16479v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: While Large Language Models (LLMs) demonstrate remarkable proficiency in semantic understanding, they often struggle to ensure structural consistency and reasoning reliability in complex decision-making tasks that demand rigorous logic. Although...

item.title: SycoEval-EM: Sycophancy Evaluation of Large Language Models in Simulated Clinical Encounters for Emergency Care
item.description: arXiv:2601.16529v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) show promise in clinical decision support yet risk acquiescing to patient pressure for inappropriate care. We introduce SycoEval-EM, a multi-agent simulation framework evaluating LLM robustness through adversarial patient...

item.title: Ordering-based Causal Discovery via Generalized Score Matching
item.description: arXiv:2601.16249v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Learning DAG structures from purely observational data remains a long-standing challenge across scientific domains. An emerging line of research leverages the score of the data distribution to initially identify a topological order of the underlying...

item.title: Student Mental Health Screening via Fitbit Data Collected During the COVID-19 Pandemic
item.description: arXiv:2601.16324v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: College students experience many stressors, resulting in high levels of anxiety and depression. Wearable technology provides unobtrusive sensor data that can be used for the early detection of mental illness. However, current research is limited...

item.title: Efficient Gaussian process learning via subspace projections
item.description: arXiv:2601.16332v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a novel training objective for GPs constructed using lower-dimensional linear projections of the data, referred to as \emph{projected likelihood} (PL). We provide a closed-form expression for the information loss related to the PL and...

item.title: Analyzing Neural Network Information Flow Using Differential Geometry
item.description: arXiv:2601.16366v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper provides a fresh view of the neural network (NN) data flow problem, i.e., identifying the NN connections that are most important for the performance of the full model, through the lens of graph theory. Understanding the NN data flow...

item.title: A Regularized Actor-Critic Algorithm for Bi-Level Reinforcement Learning
item.description: arXiv:2601.16399v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study a structured bi-level optimization problem where the upper-level objective is a smooth function and the lower-level problem is policy optimization in a Markov decision process (MDP). The upper-level decision variable parameterizes the reward...

item.title: ChiEngMixBench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Spontaneous and Natural Chinese-English Code-Mixed Generation
item.description: arXiv:2601.16217v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Code-mixing is increasingly prevalent in interactions between humans and large language models, yet existing work often reduces it to a translation or convertibility problem, making it difficult to assess whether a model's switching behavior is...

item.title: M3Kang: Evaluating Multilingual Multimodal Mathematical Reasoning in Vision-Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.16218v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Despite state-of-the-art vision-language models (VLMs) have demonstrated strong reasoning capabilities, their performance in multilingual mathematical reasoning remains underexplored, particularly when compared to human performance. To bridge this...

item.title: Domain Specific Specialization in Low-Resource Settings: The Efficacy of Offline Response-Based Knowledge Distillation in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.16219v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) excel in general tasks but often struggle with hallucinations when handling domain-specific or institutional knowledge absent from their pre-training. We present an offline response-based knowledge distillation method that...

item.title: Towards Latent Diffusion Suitable For Text
item.description: arXiv:2601.16220v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Language diffusion models aim to improve sampling speed and coherence over autoregressive LLMs. We introduce Neural Flow Diffusion Models for language generation, an extension of NFDM that enables the straightforward application of continuous...

item.title: Limits of n-gram Style Control for LLMs via Logit-Space Injection
item.description: arXiv:2601.16224v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are typically personalized via prompt engineering or parameter-efficient fine-tuning such as LoRA. However, writing style can be difficult to distill into a single prompt, and LoRA fine-tuning requires computationally...

item.title: StepFun Raises Over RMB 50 Billion in Record B+ Round, Appoints Yin Qi as Chairman
item.description: StepFun has raised over RMB 50 billion in a record B+ round and appointed AI veteran Yin Qi as chairman, accelerating its push to pair foundation models with large-scale deployment across phones and vehicles.

item.description: Jan 25, 08:05 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Disruption with repo creation
item.description: Jan 25, 03:08 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 25, 03:08 UTCUpdate - The issue has been resolved. We will continue to monitor to...

item.title: Multi-Stage Phishing Campaign Targets Russia with Amnesia RAT and Ransomware
item.description: A new multi-stage phishing campaign has been observed targeting users in Russia with ransomware and a remote access trojan called Amnesia RAT. "The attack begins with social engineering lures delivered via business-themed documents crafted to appear routine and benign," Fortinet FortiGuard Labs...

item.title: New DynoWiper Malware Used in Attempted Sandworm Attack on Polish Power Sector
item.description: The Russian nation-state hacking group known as Sandworm has been attributed to what has been described as the "largest cyber attack" targeting Poland's power system in the last week of December 2025. The attack was unsuccessful, the country's energy minister, Milosz Motyka, said last week. "The...

item.title: Scaling without Slop
item.description: We've been quiet — announcing our 2026 plans! The State of Latent Space is here.

item.title: VisGym: Diverse, Customizable, Scalable Environments for Multimodal Agents
item.description: Modern Vision-Language Models (VLMs) remain poorly characterized in multi-step visual interactions, particularly in how they integrate perception, memory, and action over long horizons. We introduce VisGym, a gymnasium of 17 environments for evaluating and training VLMs. The suite spans symbolic...

item.title: The Download: chatbots for health, and US fights over AI regulation
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. “Dr. Google” had its issues. Can ChatGPT Health do better? For the past two decades, there’s been a clear first step for anyone who starts...

item.title: America’s coming war over AI regulation
item.description: MIT Technology Review’s What’s Next series looks across industries, trends, and technologies to give you a first look at the future. You can read the rest of them here. In the final weeks of 2025, the battle over regulating artificial intelligence in the US reached a boiling point. On December 11,...

item.title: Measles is surging in the US. Wastewater tracking could help.
item.description: This week marked a rather unpleasant anniversary: It’s a year since Texas reported a case of measles—the start of a significant outbreak that ended up spreading across multiple states. Since the start of January 2025, there have been over 2,500 confirmed cases of measles in the US. Three people...

item.title: LongCat-Flash-Thinking-2601 Technical Report
item.description: We introduce LongCat-Flash-Thinking-2601, a 560-billion-parameter open-source Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) reasoning model with superior agentic reasoning capability. LongCat-Flash-Thinking-2601 achieves state-of-the-art performance among open-source models on a wide range of agentic benchmarks,...

item.title: Elevated errors: Invalid `signature` in `thinking` block
item.description: Jan 23, 07:47 UTCResolved - This issue is resolved for new requests. However, for responses from one platform received between 2026-01-23 00:00 UTC - 2026-01-23 08:00 UTC that are subsequently included in requests sent to a different platform, there may still be errors.Jan 23, 07:32 UTCMonitoring -...

item.title: SALAD: Achieve High-Sparsity Attention via Efficient Linear Attention Tuning for Video Diffusion Transformer
item.description: Diffusion Transformers have recently demonstrated remarkable performance in video generation. However, the long input sequences result in high computational latency due to the quadratic complexity of full attention. Various sparse attention mechanisms have been proposed. Training-free sparse...

item.title: Endless Terminals: Scaling RL Environments for Terminal Agents
item.description: Environments are the bottleneck for self-improving agents. Current terminal benchmarks were built for evaluation, not training; reinforcement learning requires a scalable pipeline, not just a dataset. We introduce Endless Terminals, a fully autonomous pipeline that procedurally generates...

We're restarting the systems related to the Snowsight application-hosting layer, and our initial observation of telemetry indicates that this is...

item.title: “Dr. Google” had its issues. Can ChatGPT Health do better?
item.description: For the past two decades, there’s been a clear first step for anyone who starts experiencing new medical symptoms: Look them up online. The practice was so common that it gained the pejorative moniker “Dr. Google.” But times are changing, and many medical-information seekers are now using LLMs....

item.title: DSGym: A Holistic Framework for Evaluating and Training Data Science Agents
item.description: Data science agents promise to accelerate discovery and insight-generation by turning data into executable analyses and findings. Yet existing data science benchmarks fall short due to fragmented evaluation interfaces that make cross-benchmark comparison difficult, narrow task coverage and a lack...

item.title: Dispatch from Davos: hot air, big egos and cold flexes
item.description: This story first appeared in The Debrief, our subscriber-only newsletter about the biggest news in tech by Mat Honan, Editor in Chief. Subscribe to read the next edition as soon as it lands. It’s supposed to be frigid in Davos this time of year. Part of the charm is seeing the world’s elite tromp...
